title: How to Construct a 60 Degrees Angle Using Compass and Ruler

steps.headline: Mark the vertex of your angle anywhere on the paper.
steps.description: Let us name this point as  M  .

steps.headline: Draw a ray MN, extending in any direction and of any length.
steps.description: This will be one of the arms of our angle.

steps.headline: Place the tip of the compass on point M and set its width to any measure less than the length of the ray MN.
With the tip of the compass still on M, draw an arc so as to cut the ray MN at some point (say P).
Keeping the width unchanged, place the tip of the compass on the point P and draw another arc cutting the arc drawn in the previous step at some point (say Q).
Connect the points M and Q with a straight line and extend it to form a ray ML.

text:
Mark the vertex of your angle anywhere on the paper. Let us name this point as M . Draw a ray MN, extending in any direction and of any length. This will be one of the arms of our angle. Place the tip of the compass on point M and set its width to any measure less than the length of the ray MN. With the tip of the compass still on M, draw an arc so as to cut the ray MN at some point (say P). Keeping the width unchanged, place the tip of the compass on the point P and draw another arc cutting the arc drawn in the previous step at some point (say Q). Connect the points M and Q with a straight line and extend it to form a ray ML. The measure of the angle LMN is 60. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e2\/Construct-a-60-Degrees-Angle-Using-Compass-and-Ruler-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Construct-a-60-Degrees-Angle-Using-Compass-and-Ruler-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/e2\/Construct-a-60-Degrees-Angle-Using-Compass-and-Ruler-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid3148885-v4-728px-Construct-a-60-Degrees-Angle-Using-Compass-and-Ruler-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

sentences: Mark the vertex of your angle anywhere on the paper.
Let us name this point as  M  .
Draw a ray MN, extending in any direction and of any length.
This will be one of the arms of our angle.
Place the tip of the compass on point M and set its width to any measure less than the length of the ray MN.
With the tip of the compass still on M, draw an arc so as to cut the ray MN at some point (say P).
Keeping the width unchanged, place the tip of the compass on the point P and draw another arc cutting the arc drawn in the previous step at some point (say Q).
Connect the points M and Q with a straight line and extend it to form a ray ML.
The measure of the angle LMN is 60.
